metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript JSON
JSON is a format for storing and transporting data.
content.html: JSON is a format for storing and transporting data.

content.text: JSON is often used when data is sent from a server to a web page.
content.html: JSON is often used when data is sent from a server to a web page.

content.text: What is JSON?
* The JSON syntax is derived from JavaScript object notation syntax, but the JSON format is text only. Code for reading and generating JSON data can be written in any programming language.
content.html: * The JSON syntax is derived from JavaScript object notation syntax, but the JSON format is text only. Code for reading and generating JSON data can be written in any programming language.

content.text: JSON Example
This JSON syntax defines an employees object: an array of 3 employee records (objects):
content.html: This JSON syntax defines an employees object: an array of 3 employee records (objects):

content.code_html:
{
"employees":[
  {"firstName":"John", "lastName":"Doe"},
  {"firstName":"Anna", "lastName":"Smith"},
  {"firstName":"Peter", "lastName":"Jones"}
]
}

content.text: The JSON Format Evaluates to JavaScript Objects
The JSON format is syntactically identical to the code for creating JavaScript objects.
content.html: The JSON format is syntactically identical to the code for creating JavaScript objects.

content.text: Because of this similarity, a JavaScript program can easily convert JSON data into native JavaScript objects.
content.html: Because of this similarity, a JavaScript program can easily convert JSON data into native JavaScript objects.

content.text: JSON Syntax Rules
JSON Data - A Name and a Value
JSON data is written as name/value pairs, just like JavaScript object properties.
content.html: JSON data is written as name/value pairs, just like JavaScript object properties.

content.text: A name/value pair consists of a field name (in double quotes), followed by a colon, followed by a value:
content.html: A name/value pair consists of a field name (in double quotes), followed by a colon, followed by a value:

content.code_html: "firstName":"John"

content.text: JSON names require double quotes. JavaScript names do not.
content.html: JSON names require double quotes. JavaScript names do not.

content.text: JSON Objects
JSON objects are written inside curly braces.
content.html: JSON objects are written inside curly braces.

content.text: Just like in JavaScript, objects can contain multiple name/value pairs:
content.html: Just like in JavaScript, objects can contain multiple name/value pairs:

content.code_html: {"firstName":"John", "lastName":"Doe"}

content.text: JSON Arrays
JSON arrays are written inside square brackets.
content.html: JSON arrays are written inside square brackets.

content.text: Just like in JavaScript, an array can contain objects:
content.html: Just like in JavaScript, an array can contain objects:

content.code_html:
"employees":[
  {"firstName":"John", "lastName":"Doe"},
  {"firstName":"Anna", "lastName":"Smith"},
  {"firstName":"Peter", "lastName":"Jones"}
]

content.text: In the example above, the object "employees" is an array. It contains three objects.
content.html: In the example above, the object "employees" is an array. It contains three objects.

content.text: Each object is a record of a person (with a first name and a last name).
content.html: Each object is a record of a person (with a first name and a last name).

content.text: Converting a JSON Text to a JavaScript Object
A common use of JSON is to read data from a web server, and display the data in a web page.
content.html: A common use of JSON is to read data from a web server, and display the data in a web page.

content.text: For simplicity, this can be demonstrated using a string as input.
content.html: For simplicity, this can be demonstrated using a string as input.

content.text: First, create a JavaScript string containing JSON syntax:
content.html: First, create a JavaScript string containing JSON syntax:

content.code_html:
let text = '{ "employees" : [' +
'{ "firstName":"John" , "lastName":"Doe" },' +
'{ "firstName":"Anna" , "lastName":"Smith" },' +
'{ "firstName":"Peter" , "lastName":"Jones" } ]}';

content.text: Then, use the JavaScript built-in function JSON.parse() to convert the string into a JavaScript object:
content.html: Then, use the JavaScript built-in function JSON.parse() to convert the string into a JavaScript object:

content.code_html: const obj = JSON.parse(text);

content.text: Finally, use the new JavaScript object in your page:
content.html: Finally, use the new JavaScript object in your page:

content.code_html:
<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML =
obj.employees[1].firstName + " " + obj.employees[1].lastName;
</script>

content.text: You can read more about JSON in our JSON tutorial .
content.html: You can read more about JSON in our JSON tutorial.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What does JSON stand for?
content.html: What does JSON stand for?

content.question: What does JSON stand for?
